title: Cinema and childhood: the child in question
abstractText: This research explores both cinema and childhood as distinct, but converging, 'intuitions' of modern culture, Emerging towards the end of the 19th century, cinema plays a key role, alongside psychoanalysis of childhood, literature and photography, in the construction of modern conceptions of childhood. Starting from the idea of cinema as a new way of seeing and showing, the child, this project demonstrates the important of the domain of the visual in cultural, and political, preoccupations with the child: in particular, it will address contemporary anxiety concerning the 'death of childhood' and the child as a privileged figure of our vulnerability to others.
